required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determine the Effect of Multiple Doses of AZD7325, CYP Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Open-Labeled, Fixed Sequence Study to Determine the Effect of Multiple Doses of AZD7325 on the Pharmacokinetics of Midazolam (CYP3A4) and Caffeine (CYP1A2)

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the effects of repeated doses of AZD7325 on the pharmacokinetic profile of a CYP3A4 substrate (midazolam and its 1' hydroxy metabolite) and a CYP1A2 substrate (caffeine and its paraxanthine [3-desmethyl] metabolite).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the effects of repeated doses of AZD7325 on the pharmacokinetic profile of a CYP3A4 substrate (midazolam and its 1' hydroxy metabolite) and a CYP1A2 substrate (caffeine and its paraxanthine [3-desmethyl] metabolite).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples will be taken during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated doses of AZD7325 in combination with midazolam and caffeine.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples will be taken during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the pharmacodynamic effects of AZD7325
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Test batteries will be performed at specified times both before and following study drug administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of AZD7325
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples will be taken on Days 1, 11 and 12.

criteria.textblock:
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically relevant abnormalities in physical examinations, vital signs, clinical chemistry, hematology or urinalysis as judged by the investigator and/or sponsor.
- Enrollment in another concurrent investigational study or intake of an investigational drug within 3 months or intake of an investigational drug within a period of 5 half lives of that drug prior to the screening visit

responsible_party.name_title: Mark A. Smith, MD, PhDMedical Science Sr.Director
